meanings.definition: A spot, stain, or small discolored area
meanings.sent1: The macula on the carpet was difficult to remove.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a small macula on her shirt after the spill.
meanings.sent3: The macula on the wall looked like a tiny painting.
meanings.sent4: The beauty mark on her face was like a macula of uniqueness.
meanings.sent5: The macula on the leaf made it stand out from the rest.

meanings.definition: A small yellowish central area of the retina that is rich in cones and that mediates clear detailed vision
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined her macula during the eye check-up.
meanings.sent2: The macula is essential for sharp vision and color perception.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his macula was like a tiny superhero in his eye.
meanings.sent4: Her focus was as sharp as a macula in the eye of a storm.
meanings.sent5: The macula allows us to see fine details clearly.
